page.title: 20GRINLING GIBBONS SCHOOL
page.content: Grinling Gibbons school was built in 1951.There has been a school by that name in Clyde street for over a 100 years, but the original building was destroyed by a bomb during the second world war.The school is named after a famous woodcarver alive in the 17th century.He was born and worked in deptford.The number of children in the school at the time of writing is 190. There are 15 full time nursery children and 18 part time.The school is very mixed culturaily.Here are the propartions that make up this junior mixed and infant school Afro-Carribean--30%, North West Indian--8%, Turkish--5%, Indo Chinese (Vietnamese)--20%, Indiginous--37% There are nine full time members of staff and two part time teachers.
